CHAPTER 6
TREES AND SHRUBBERY 1
SECTION:
3-6-1: Planting; Permit Required
3-6-2: Removal; Permit Required
3-6-3: Injury
3-6-4: Advertisements; Notices
3-6-5: Removal Or Pruning Of Hazardous Trees And Shrubs
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 2, chapter 11 of this code.
3-6-1: PLANTING; PERMIT REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to plant any trees or bushes in any public street or
parkway or any other public place or between the curb line and a distance of
five feet (5') inside the property line of any property without first having
secured the permission of the Director of Public Works or his or her designee.
(Ord. 286, 9-15-1959; amd. 2020 Code)
3-6-2: REMOVAL; PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall remove or cut down any tree or shrub in any such public place
without first having secured the permission of the Director of Public Works or
his or her designee. (1950 Code; amd. 2020 Code)
3-6-3: INJURY:
No person shall injure any tree or shrub planted or growing in any public
place. (1950 Code)
3-6-4: ADVERTISEMENTS; NOTICES:
No person shall attach any sign, advertisement or notice to any tree or shrub
in any public place. (1950 Code)
3-6-5: REMOVAL OR PRUNING OR HAZARDOUS TREES AND SHRUBS:
The Director of Public Works may order the pruning or removal of any tree or
shrub which poses an imminent physical hazard to persons or property. Such
conditions include, but are not limited to, any tree or shrub which overhangs
any sidewalk, street or other public place in such a way as to impede or
interfere with traffic or travel, is unsafe or which, by reason of its nature,
is injurious to sewers, electric power lines, gas lines, water lines, other
utilities present or other public improvements, or is infested with any
injurious fungus or insects or other pests. In the event the hazardous tree or
shrub is located upon private property, the Director of Public Works shall
notify the property owner in writing and the property owner shall have sixty
(60) days to comply with the order of the Director of Public Works or to file a
written appeal for review by the council. (2020 Code)
CHAPTER 7
CEMETERY REGULATIONS
SECTION:
3-7-1: Management Of Cemetery
3-7-2: Promulgation Of Regulations
3-7-3: Record Of Lots, Values And Sales To Be Kept
3-7-4: Application For Purchase Of Cemetery Lots
3-7-5: Contracts Now In Force To Continue
3-7-6: Superintendent Of Oakwood Cemetery
3-7-7: Custody Of Cemetery
3-7-8: Monthly Report
3-7-9: Payment For Services Rendered
3-7-10: Superintendent To Care For Grounds
3-7-11: Burial Permits Required
3-7-12: Application For Permit; Issuance
3-7-13: Record Of Burial Permits
3-7-14: Record Of Interments
3-7-15: Delivery Of Cemetery Property To Successor
3-7-16: Receipts
3-7-17: Expenditures
3-7-18: Endowments
3-7-19: Dogs Prohibited
3-7-1: MANAGEMENT OF CEMETERY:
The City Manager shall have custody of Oakwood Cemetery and supervision over
the Superintendent of the cemetery and all employees having duties concerned
with the care and maintenance of said cemetery. (Ord. 3040, 5-15-2017)
3-7-2: PROMULGATION OF REGULATIONS:
Subject to the approval of the City Council, the City Manager shall prescribe
the rules and regulations for the government of Oakwood Cemetery and the sale
and use of lots therein. (Ord. 3040, 5-15-2017)
3-7-3: RECORD OF LOTS, VALUES AND SALES TO BE KEPT:
The Clerk shall keep an accurate plat of the Oakwood Cemetery and also a record
of the blocks or squares or lots in each division thereof, with the amounts of
the appraised values of the lots or blocks at which the same shall be offered
for sale, and, when sold, the name of the purchaser, the amount sold for, and
the date of sale. (Ord. 102, 2-1-1955)
3-7-4: APPLICATION FOR PURCHASE OF CEMETERY LOTS:
All applications for the purchase of cemetery lots shall be made to the
Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery, to the Clerk, or when it is desired to
purchase any lot the title to which has not yet passed to the City but is yet
vested in a trustee, then to such trustee. All applications must be accompanied
by a down payment of fifty percent (50%) of the purchase price. No conveyance
to the purchaser shall be made until the full amount of the purchase price of
the lot has been paid. All unpaid balances shall accrue interest at the rate of
five percent (5%) per annum. (Ord. 2641, 5-21-2007)
3-7-5: CONTRACTS NOW IN FORCE TO CONTINUE:
Nothing contained in this chapter shall be held or taken to impair or modify
the terms of a certain contract entered into on behalf of the City under and by
virtue of the terms of an ordinance entitled "an ordinance to provide for the
purpose of land to be used as an addition to Oakwood Cemetery, to be owned and
controlled by the City of Dixon", passed by the Council July 3, 1903, and
approved by the Mayor July 14, 1903, but said ordinance and any and all
agreements or contracts entered into by virtue thereof, shall be and remain in
full force and effect. (Ord. 102, 2-1-1955)
3-7-6: SUPERINTENDENT OF OAKWOOD CEMETERY:
The Director of Public Works shall be the Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery.
(Ord. 3040, 5-15-2017)
3-7-7: CUSTODY OF CEMETERY:
The Superintendent shall, subject to the direction of the Commissioner of
Public Property and the Council, have the care, control, charge and management
of the cemetery controlled by the City and known as "Oakwood Cemetery". (Ord.
102, 2-1-1955)
3-7-8: MONTHLY REPORT:
The Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery, or other person in charge or control of
the same, shall, on or before the first Monday in each month, furnish to the
Clerk for the information of the Council a report, in writing, showing the
number of interments in the cemetery during the preceding month with the name,
sex, race and color of each person so interred, the date and place of death,
the cause of death, and when practicable, the age, occupation, nationality and
place of residence of the deceased together with a report in detail of receipts
and disbursements. (Ord. 102, 2-1-1955)
3-7-9: PAYMENT FOR SERVICES RENDERED:
It shall be the duty of the Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery to collect from
the persons for whom work or services are performed in the cemetery such
amounts as shall be prescribed from time to time by the City Council. All
foundation work shall be performed by cemetery employees and charges for the
same must be paid in advance prior to commencement of installation. (Ord. 3040,
5-15-2017)
3-7-10: SUPERINTENDENT TO CARE FOR GROUNDS:
The Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery shall have charge of the cemetery
subject to the direction of the City Manager and shall keep and preserve the
buildings, grounds and fences in good order and repair and the monuments,
tombstones, shrubbery and every other thing erected and placed in the cemetery,
for ornament or otherwise, free from injury or defacement and the walks and
avenues in good condition and free from obstructions. He shall enforce the
provisions of this Code in relation to cemeteries and the rules and regulations
established for the government of the same and shall report all violations.
(Ord. 3040, 5-15-2017)
3-7-11: BURIAL PERMITS REQUIRED:
No burial or interment shall take place nor shall the body of any person be
removed without a permit for such burial or removal from the Clerk. No burial
permit shall be issued unless the purchase price of the lot has been paid in
full. No burial or interment shall take place except that of a human being and
no dog, cat or bird or any other previously living animal shall be buried or
interred in Oakwood Cemetery or any part thereof, at any time in the future.
(Ord. 2641, 5-21-2007)
3-7-12: APPLICATION FOR PERMIT; ISSUANCE:
Any person desiring a burial permit shall file with the Clerk a certificate, in
writing, signed by the attending physician or coroner, stating the name, age,
sex, nationality, residence and occupation of the deceased, if known, and the
cause or manner of death; and in case of any death where there has been no
attending physician or coroner, the certificate signed by the parent of the
deceased; or, if none, by some member of the family, not a minor; or, if none,
by the resident householder, where the death occurred; or, if none, by any
reputable citizen acquainted with the facts and circumstances of the death.
Upon the filing of such certificate, the Clerk shall issue a burial permit.
In the event of the absence or inability to act of the Clerk, or Deputy Clerk,
the Commissioner of Public Health and Safety is authorized, empowered and
directed to issue such burial permit upon compliance with the requirements of
this section. (1950 Code)
3-7-13: RECORD OF BURIAL PERMITS:
It shall be the duty of the Clerk to enter in a suitable book to be kept in his
office for that purpose, a record of all permits so issued, specifying the date
of issue, and to whom issued, together with all the items of information
contained in the certificates upon which such permits were issued. (1950 Code)
3-7-14: RECORD OF INTERMENTS:
The Superintendent of Oakwood Cemetery, upon receiving the Clerk's permit and
making an interment, shall enter the name of the deceased with the date of
interment and the number of the lot in which interred, in a book to be kept for
such purpose; he shall make no interment without the delivery to him of a
permit. Double stacking of interments is prohibited. (Ord. 2641, 5-21-2007)
3-7-15: DELIVERY OF CEMETERY PROPERTY TO SUCCESSOR:
The Superintendent, upon the appointment of his successor in office, shall
deliver to him all property, books, records, maps and effects of every
description in his possession or under his control belonging to the City or
pertaining to his office; and, in case of his neglect or refusal to deliver the
same, within three (3) days after demand being made therefor, he shall be
subject to the general penalty provided by this Code. (1950 Code)
3-7-16: RECEIPTS:
All monies, receipts, income and revenue from Oakwood Cemetery collected or
received by an officer or employee of the City shall be turned over to the
Clerk who shall give a receipt therefor and keep a separate account of the
revenue. (1950 Code)
3-7-17: EXPENDITURES:
The separate fund provided for in section
3-7-16 of this chapter shall be the primary fund and first applied toward
defraying the expenses of Oakwood Cemetery and the disbursements thereof. The
remaining expenses, if any, shall be paid from the proper appropriation and
levy. (1950 Code)
3-7-18: ENDOWMENTS:
All lots sold in Oakwood Cemetery (including Oaklawn Addition) shall only be
sold with the perpetual endowment thereof provided within the sale price of the
lots. Twenty five percent (25%) of the total sale price of the lots in Oakwood
Cemetery shall be deposited with the Treasurer to create a perpetual care
endowment fund of the lots.
Each and every lot endowed shall, at all times, be kept to a proper and
established grade, well seeded with grass and the grass cut and neatly trimmed
around the base of any and all monuments, trees, shrubbery or bushes placed or
growing thereon. (Ord. 782, 6-3-1974)
3-7-19: DOGS PROHIBITED:
No dog shall be permitted in Oakwood Cemetery. The owner of any dog which is
found within Oakwood Cemetery shall be subject to a fine as provided in section
9-4-7 of this Code. (Ord. 1874, 5-1-1995)
CHAPTER 8
WATERWORKS SYSTEM
SECTION:
3-8-1: Scope; Definitions
3-8-2: Application For Water Service
3-8-2-1: Connection Restriction
3-8-3: Connection With Water Main
3-8-4: Water Meters
3-8-5: Protection Of Water Division Property
3-8-6: Access To Premises
3-8-7: Discontinuing Of Service For Repairs
3-8-8: Notice To Plumbers And Excavators
3-8-9: Fire Hydrants
3-8-10: Payment Of Water Bills
3-8-11: Cessation Of Water Service
3-8-12: Water Main Extensions For New Subdivisions And Otherwise
3-8-12-1: Water Main Extensions And Subdivision Specifications
3-8-13: Replacing Or Repairing Water Service
3-8-14: Outside Meter Reading Devices (Rep. by Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-15: Water Rates
3-8-16: Intent And Purpose
3-8-17: Cross Connections
3-8-18: Penalty
3-8-19: General Financial Provisions
3-8-20:    Residential Water Service Line Repair Program
3-8-1: SCOPE; DEFINITIONS:
The following rules and regulations specified in this chapter shall be
established by the City. Such rules and regulations shall be controlling in the
use of water to the respective water users of the City in the future.
CONSUMER OR CUSTOMER: The person who is responsible for the payment of water
bills.
LARGE USER: Any user who exceeds water usage over 7,479,252 gallons in a month.
OWNER: The actual owner of the property to be supplied with water service.
UTILITY SERVICE FEE: The utility service fee is comprised of the following, as
applicable: a) the actual cost of the installed water meter; b) the deposit
provided for in section
3-8-2 of this chapter; and c) the tapping fee provided for in section
3-8-3 of this chapter.
WATER DIVISION: The Water Division of the City of Dixon, Illinois.
Any references herein to a measurement in diameter shall mean the measurement
of the inside diameter, or the applicable industry standards of measurement
thereto. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018; amd. Ord. 3308, 6-6-2022)
3-8-2: APPLICATION FOR WATER SERVICE:
Any customer desiring water service shall make application through the City
website or at City Hall, using forms furnished by the Water Division. The
customer shall make a deposit based upon the size of the water meter to be
installed in accordance with the following schedule:
Meter Size Fee
Meter Size   Fee
5/8" or 3/4" $ 100.00
1"           125.00
11/2"        175.00
2"           225.00
3"           325.00
4"           425.00
6"           625.00
8"           825.00
10"          1,025.00
 
Upon the termination of water service in accordance with this chapter, the
deposit shall be applied to any outstanding balance remaining on the customer's
final water bill. The remainder of the deposit, if any, after payment of the
final water bill shall be returned to the customer. (Ord. 3114, 11-5-2018)
   (A)   If a multiple-family dwelling is served by a single meter, the
appropriate deposit shall be made based upon the size of the water meter to be
installed, plus an additional deposit of twenty five dollars ($25.00) for each
additional unit.
   (B)   For all properties having more than one tenant and only one meter, the
meter shall be in the landlord's name. The landlord shall be responsible for
payment of the water bills and any damages to said meter.
   (C)   Notwithstanding the foregoing, for any person owning more than one
property used for leasing to tenants, and provided further that each such
property has more than one meter, then the owner may elect to make a landlord
deposit in the amount of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00). In the event the
amount of the landlord deposit made falls below one thousand dollars
($1,000.00) for any reason, the owner shall, within fifteen (15) days of notice
from the City of the same, deposit with the City such amounts as may be
necessary to return the landlord deposit on file to one thousand dollars
($1,000.00). In the event the owner fails to return the landlord deposit to one
thousand dollars ($1,000.00) as required in the preceding sentence, the
landlord deposit option made available pursuant to this subsection (C) shall be
unavailable to the owner and such owner shall be required to comply in all
respects with other deposit provisions set forth in this section. (Ord. 3110,
9-17-2018)
3-8-2-1: CONNECTION RESTRICTION:
No customer or owner of property located outside the corporate limits shall be
allowed to connect to the City's waterworks system except where annexation to
the City is legally prohibited. Upon removal of the prohibition, the property
must be immediately annexed to the City.
Connection to the City waterworks system by a customer located outside the
corporate limits of the City shall be allowed only under the following
conditions:
   (A)   The owner of the property to be connected to the City waterworks
system is unable to annex to the City because the property is not adjacent or
contiguous to the City.
   (B)   The owner of the property agrees in writing to petition the City for
annexation to the City when the property becomes contiguous to the City.
   (C)   Annexation to the City can be anticipated in the foreseeable future.
   (D)   The City derives and will continue to derive a significant benefit
from the user or there is a potential economic benefit from the user that the
City will derive.
   (E)   The economic benefit derived by the City shall exceed the cost, if
any, incurred by the City for the extension of such waterworks service.
   (F)   The owner or user shall pay the cost of extending waterworks service
from existing water lines to the extremities of the property for easy access by
future upstream extensions, and all engineering and maintenance costs. The City
may, at its discretion, contribute to the cost of extending the waterworks line
if the City requires the user or owner to install waterworks line of larger
than standard size as defined elsewhere in this Code. (Ord. 1519, 2-20-1990)
3-8-3: CONNECTION WITH WATER MAIN:
The Water Division will make the necessary service connection at the water
main, the cost of which is to be paid by the owner or contractor. The cost is
to be regulated by the Water Division in accordance with the prevailing cost of
labor and materials at the time of installation or replacement.
All new connections from a family dwelling to any water main of the City shall
cost the sum of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) for services up to one inch
(1"). This section, however, does not apply to installations where the cost of
such installation has been paid by the developer of a subdivision, or such
other person as may be applicable pursuant to section
3-8-12 of this chapter.
All commercial and industrial connections to any water main of the City shall
require a one thousand dollar ($1,000.00) connection fee and a two hundred
fifty dollar ($250.00) tap fee. In addition, there shall be a two hundred fifty
dollar ($250.00) fee if the tapping sleeve and valve are put on by the Water
Division. All materials shall be furnished by the owner or contractor.
The owner shall lay and maintain the service pipe from the water main to the
premises and shall, for single-family dwellings, install a Mueller H-15155 or
A.Y. McDonald 6107BQ curb stop in an easily accessible place near the wall
where the service pipe enters the building. For multiple-family dwellings, the
owner shall install a separate outside shutoff for each dwelling and a "lock
type" stop valve in an easily accessible place near the wall where the service
pipe enters the building. The owner shall also install a valve on the outlet
side of the meter. The owner shall install, on every service pipe, a curb stop
and curb box. The curb stop shall be located within the street right-of-way and
shall be approximately six feet (6') from the property line.
In the event that repairs to the water service are necessary, existing meter
pits must be replaced. The meters must be moved inside the building and the
pits filled in and abandoned.
All new and repaired water service pipes two inches (2") in diameter and
smaller shall be type K soft copper pipe or SDR9 ADS polyflex (200 psi rating)
one inch (1") or greater in diameter. All service pipes larger than two inches
(2") in diameter shall be ductile iron thickness, Class No. 52 cable bond. The
property owner must install a tracer wire from the water main to the premises.
All installations or replacements of water service pipes shall be subject to
the inspection and approval of the City building inspector, consulting engineer
or authorized agent of the Water Division.
The type and manufacture of fire hydrants, valves, street boxes and water
meters must be in accordance with standard specifications approved by the Water
Division. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-4: WATER METERS:
All water used by every water customer shall be measured and recorded with a
water meter. The water meter shall be supplied and installed by the Water
Division and shall be and remain at all times the property of the Water
Division. The Water Division will install meters that are one inch (1") and
smaller into completed plumbing. All other meters shall be installed by the
owner and inspected and approved by the Water Division after installation. For
all new installations, the utility service fee and the costs of installation
shall be paid in full, together with hook-on fees and any other fee due to the
Water Division at City Hall before installation shall be made. All new
installations or remodeling of properties shall have a smartpoint and, in the
Water Manager's discretion, a touchpad. The water meter shall be installed at a
location protected from freezing or heat and other hazards, and the outside
reading device (remote transmitter), if any, shall be installed at a point that
is visible from the front or side street. It shall be the customer's
responsibility to keep the meter from being damaged or frozen. If such damage
or freezing occurs, it shall be the customer's responsibility to pay for the
costs of replacement or repair, including any applicable charges or fees
provided for herein as a result. The cost of all water meters shall be
established from time to time by the Water Manager. Forty five (45) days after
installation of a new meter, the prior meter will be disposed of by the Water
Division. Customers shall have the opportunity, during such forty five (45) day
period, to dispute the accuracy of the removed meter. Any commercial building
served with water service shall include in the meter installation a proper
bypass, approved by the Water Division, which allows for continued use of water
when a meter is removed for maintenance or testing. Lock valves shall also be
included on such bypasses at the owner's expense.
Charges for testing residential, commercial and industrial meters shall be
based on the actual cost for labor and materials expended by the Water
Division. Should the customer desire the test to be made, the Water Division
employee will, in the customer's presence, seal the meter before he leaves the
customer's presence. If the results of the water meter test indicate that the
meter is measuring higher than the standards set forth by the American Water
Works Association (AWWA), then the meter shall be repaired or replaced at no
cost to the customer and all testing fees shall be reimbursed.
When the water meter fails to register, the charge for water used during the
period of non-registration will be determined from an average corresponding
period. When such an average is obviously unfair to either the customer or the
Water Division, an average will be agreed to by both parties. If both parties
cannot agree, all the facts will be submitted to the City Council and their
decision will be final.
Illegal use of water or of property of the Water Division or of the meter
devices shall result in criminal prosecution. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-5: PROTECTION OF WATER DIVISION PROPERTY:
All piping, gauges, appliances, equipment and other devices installed by the
Water Division, and all water meters, regardless of who performed the
installation, which may be in or about the customer's premises shall be and
remain the property of the Water Division. The customer shall protect and be
responsible for such property in the case of loss or damages. Only authorized
agents of the Water Division will be permitted to remove, install or replace
such property. The owner or customer shall maintain free access to all Water
Division property. The owner or customer shall not store or construct any
obstacles which will interfere with the reading, repairing or removal of the
water meter. The owner shall keep his or her curb box and curb stop free from
obstruction so that the water can be turned on or off whenever necessary
without delay. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-6: ACCESS TO PREMISES:
Authorized agents of the Water Division shall at all reasonable hours have
access to the premises for the purpose of inspecting the customer's
installation and of reading, repairing, testing, terminating service, restoring
service or removing the water meter or other Water Division property. All
authorized agents of the Water Division can and shall present an identification
card if asked to do so. Upon the presentation of the card, the authorized agent
shall have free access at any reasonable hour to any premises supplied with
City water for the purpose of making an inspection of the entire supply, upon
the premises or reading or repairing the water meter or other Water Division
property. Failure to allow access to premises will result in termination of
service. Cost of terminating service and service restoration will be the
responsibility of the property owner. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-7: DISCONTINUING OF SERVICE FOR REPAIRS:
When it is necessary for the Water Division to interrupt water service for the
purpose of repairing or extending the main, it will endeavor to give notice of
interruption and shut off the water at a time when it will cause the least
inconvenience to the customer. In case of a break in the main or pumping
equipment requiring an immediate shutdown or interruption of service, the Water
Division shall not be required to provide prior notice to its customers. All
boilers or tanks on the customer's premises that are connected directly with
the service pipe shall be provided with reduced pressure zone backflow
preventers that adequately prevent their collapse in the event water is
suddenly shut off. Only persons authorized by the Water Manager shall turn on
or off water valves or curb stops. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-8: NOTICE TO PLUMBERS AND EXCAVATORS:
All plumbers and contractors shall contact the Manager of the Water Division
prior to performing any excavating. The Water Manager or his or her authorized
representatives will mark the appropriate location of any underground water
main or service. The plumber or contractor shall take every precaution to
prevent damage to the water main or service pipe. If any damages do occur, the
plumber or person that caused the damage shall pay the cost of repairing same
to the Water Division. The person causing the damage to the water main or
service shall also be responsible for any other liability resulting from the
broken service pipe or water main. No person shall tap, repair, change or
otherwise disturb the mains or service pipes without the permission of the
Water Manager or his or her authorized representative. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-9: FIRE HYDRANTS:
Fire hydrants are for the use of the Fire Division for the purpose of
extinguishing fires. Persons other than members of the Fire Division and
persons authorized by the Water Manager shall not open or attempt to draw water
from any fire hydrant.
   (A)   Filling of swimming pools from a fire hydrant is prohibited. In
addition, filling of tanker trucks from fire hydrants is prohibited.
   (B)   Any party requesting water from a fire hydrant shall be responsible to
make application at City Hall. The party shall be charged the normal water rate
as specified in this Code, plus a twenty five dollar ($25.00) setting fee and
the required deposit as established from time to time by the Water Division.
The setting fee shall include the installation and removal of a hydrant meter.
The deposit will be applied to the final water bill. In addition, all tanker
trucks must fill at the water plant and not at the hydrants. No hydrant may be
operated without the prior permission of the Water Manager or his or her
designee. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-10: PAYMENT OF WATER BILLS:
   (A)   Billings:
      1.   Due Date; Delinquency: All water bills shall be paid on or before
the due dates as noted on the water bill. A bill becomes delinquent twenty two
(22) days after rendition of the bill for such services. A ten percent (10%)
penalty shall be assessed and added to all delinquent bills. If the bill,
together with any applicable penalty charge, is not paid within such period,
service may be discontinued and terminated pursuant to section
3-8-16 of this chapter. An administrative fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall
be applied to all bills not paid within thirty eight (38) days from the bill
statement period. In such cases where service has been discontinued pursuant to
section
3-8-16 of this chapter, the water service will not be reconnected until the
water bill has been paid in full.
      2.   Billing: Bills and notices shall be mailed to the customer's last
address as shown by the records of the Water Division. If the customer has
elected to receive water bills electronically, said bill will be sent to the
last email address on file with the Water Division.
      3.   Paperless Billing: A customer may elect to receive his, her or its
water bills electronically to the customer's email address.
      4.   Payment: A water bill may be paid: a) online through the City's
website established for such purpose; b) by mail; or c) in person at City Hall.
Failure to receive a water bill will not relieve the customer from his, her or
its obligation to pay the bill.
      5.   Delayed Payment Agreements: The City may, in the discretion of the
Water Manager, enter into a delayed payment agreement with a delinquent
customer. The customer shall comply with such agreement in all respects and,
upon failure to comply, shall be subject to the lien and termination of service
provisions provided for in this chapter.
   (B)   Person Responsible For Payment: The owner of the premises, the
occupant thereof, and the user of the water service shall be jointly and
severally liable to pay for the service to such premises and the service is
furnished to the premises by the City only upon the condition that the owner of
the premises, occupant and user of the service are jointly and severally liable
thereof to the City.
   (C)   Lien Notice Of Delinquency:
      1.   Lien: In the event charges for water service remain unpaid for
twenty two (22) days after rendition of the bill for such services, such
charges shall be deemed and are hereby declared to be delinquent, and
thereafter such delinquency may constitute a lien upon the real estate for
which service is supplied, and the City Clerk be and is hereby authorized and
directed to file with the County Recorder of Deeds of Lee County a notice of
lien claim at any time after the bill has become delinquent. The filing of such
statement shall be deemed notice of the lien for said water service. This
notice shall consist of a sworn statement setting out:
         (a)   A legal description of the premises served;
         (b)   The amount of money due for such water service; and
         (c)   The date when such amount became delinquent.
      2.   Notification: If the user whose bill is unpaid is not the owner of
the premises and the City has notice of this, notice shall be mailed to the
owner of the premises, if his or her address be known to the Water Division,
whenever the bill remains unpaid for a period of twenty two (22) days after
rendition of the bill. The notice shall be sufficient to inform the owner of
the premises that the charges or rates have become delinquent and that unpaid
charges may create a lien on the real estate under subsection (C)1 of this
section. The procedure for customer disputes contained in subsection
3-8-16(E) of this chapter shall be available to the owner of the premises
should the owner wish to dispute imposition of the lien on the premises where
service was provided. Failure of the City to mail such notice or the failure of
the owner to receive such notice shall not affect the right of the City to file
and foreclose the lien for unpaid bills, as provided in this chapter.
      3.   Foreclosure Of Lien: Property subject to a lien for unpaid charges
shall be foreclosed in the manner as provided by the Illinois Compiled
Statutes.
      4.   Costs: In all cases where the charges or rates established under
this chapter become delinquent, and it becomes necessary to file a statement
thereof in the Office of the Recorder of Deeds, there shall be added as part of
such delinquent charge the Recorder's fee for the filing of said statement and
the costs verifying the legal description of the property on which such lien is
attached and the City Clerk is hereby directed and authorized to include said
additions in her sworn statements showing such delinquency.
   (D)   Filing Of Notice: When this chapter shall become effective, a copy
thereof properly certified by the City shall be filed in the Office of the
Recorder of Deeds of Lee County and shall be deemed notice to all owners of
real estate of their liability for charges for the water system supplied to any
occupant or user of such service on their property. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-11: CESSATION OF WATER SERVICE:
Whenever a premises is to be vacated or closed for any period of time,
application shall be made to the Water Division to have the water supply shut
off. The Water Division shall then shut off the water and remove (if
applicable) and read the meter. The water customer will then be given a bill
based on the meter reading, along with any additional fees or charges permitted
or required by this chapter. If the customer is moving from the premises, the
deposit will be applied to the final bill. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-12: WATER MAIN EXTENSIONS FOR NEW SUBDIVISIONS AND OTHERWISE:
All subdividers shall submit plans for water main extension to the Water
Manager for approval. The plans shall indicate the size and the location of all
water mains, valves and fire hydrants. The plans shall also indicate the size
and location of all lots and streets. After the plans have been approved by the
Water Manager, Consulting Engineers, Building Official, and the Fire Chief, the
plans must then be submitted to the Illinois EPA Division of Public Water
Supplies, Springfield, Illinois, for approval. No work shall be started on any
extension until approval has been received by the Water Division and a
construction permit is received. A new installation shall not be put in service
until after an operating permit has been received by the Water Division. The
entire water system shall be installed by and paid for by the subdivider.
Fire hydrants shall be located at the corner of each block and on the end of
all dead end mains. Intermediate hydrants will be required on long blocks as
required by the Water Manager or City Engineer. All hydrants must be set so
that the center of the nozzle should be not less than eighteen inches (18")
from ground level. The water main shall be extended to the extremities of the
subdivision so that future water main extensions will not require excavation in
the subdivision.
RW valves will be installed on the lead to all fire hydrants. RW valves shall
be located on all but one of the branches at each intersection. In no event
shall RW valves be located more than eight hundred feet (800') apart. The water
main shall be connected into the existing water system at every possible
location. Dead end water mains shall be avoided wherever possible.
In such cases where the subdivider is required to provide larger diameter mains
for future expansion and said subdivider believes he is entitled to additional
reimbursement, he shall appear before the City Council. The City Council will
study the facts of the case and may or may not give additional reimbursement.
The reimbursement is to be made based on the size of the pipe which the City
Council may require be installed and the size main which must be installed in
the subdivision to satisfy the fire flow in each subdivision or instance. This
would be based on eight inch (8") minimum size of the main. The installation of
the water main shall be inspected and the entire installation shall be approved
by the Water Division, the consulting engineer, and the Manager of the Water
Division prior to final acceptance of the subdivision by the City. In such
cases where, after a showing of good cause by the subdivider that the
requirements of this section or of section
3-8-12-1 of this chapter cannot be met, the Water Manager may approve such
suitable replacements as he or she may allow in his or her absolute discretion.
For connections outside the City limits, the following shall apply:
All persons making connections to any main outside of the City limits shall pay
the same hook-on fee, meter and deposit as required within the City. The water
billing rate is one hundred fifteen percent (115%) of the rate applicable
within the City limits. Also, the property owner shall sign a written agreement
that the water user will annex his or her property to the City when and if said
property shall become contiguous to said City.
The provisions of this section shall also apply to any water main extensions,
including those not done for the construction of new subdivisions. (Ord. 3110,
9-17-2018)
3-8-12-1: WATER MAIN EXTENSIONS AND SUBDIVISION SPECIFICATIONS:
   (A)   All water mains shall be either PVC or ductile iron pipe and satisfy
the specifications set forth in this section. All water mains shall be minimum
six inches (6") in diameter.
   (B)   Ductile iron pipe (AWWA C-151), Class 52 (AWWA C-150), cement lined
(AWWA C-104) with mechanical or push-on type joints and elastomeric seals
(gaskets) used for push-on joint (ASTM F477).
   (C)   Polyvinyl chloride pipe (PVC) (AWWA C-909), pressure class 235, with
bell and spigot push-on joints and elastomeric gaskets. All service tap
installations up to two inches (2") in diameter must be done utilizing Smith
Blair 315 or 317 tapping saddles or the Cascade equivalent. PVC pipe must be
installed utilizing the Copperhead Tracer Wire System or equivalent as approved
by city.
   (D)   For all water main extensions and improvements, the owner or user will
provide written certification by a registered engineer that the pipe has been
properly installed in accordance with Standard Specifications for Water and
Sewer Main Construction in Illinois and a written guarantee for workmanship to
all repairs and replacements for five years from the date of acceptance of the
project by city.
   (E)   All water mains shall be pressure tested, disinfected and tested for
contamination prior to putting the system into service; this shall be performed
in accordance with city and state Environmental Protection Agency requirements.
   (F)   All water main fittings shall be Class 52 ductile iron pipe conforming
to AWWA C151 and C111.
   (G)   All ductile iron pipe shall be wrapped in polyethylene encasement and
will meet the requirements of ANSI/AWWA C105/A21.5.4.
   (H)   Polyethylene encasement shall be V-Bio Poly Wrap.
   (I)   All valves shall be gate valves Mueller RW (resilient wedge), Clow RW,
Kennedy RW or the AFC 2500 RW. Valves shall be designed with a direction of
opening to the right (clockwise) with resilient wedge, ductile iron body with
mechanical joint ends.
   (J)   Fire hydrants shall be Mueller Centurion, Clow Medallion or the
Kennedy Guardian K-81 with break flange construction. All fire hydrants shall
be designed with a direction of opening to the right (clockwise) with a six
inch (6") mechanical joint shoe. Hydrants shall have two (2) 2.5-inch hose
nozzles and one integral factory installed five-inch (5") Storz connector. The
nozzles shall have national standard hose threads. All fire hydrant runs shall
have an RW valve installed on them for hydrant maintenance. All fire hydrants
shall be safety orange in color.
   (K)   All new and repaired water service lines two inch (2") in diameter and
smaller shall be type K soft copper pipe or SDR9 ADS polyflex (200 psi rating)
one inch (1") or greater in diameter. All SDR 9 pipe must have a tracer wire
ran with it. Service lines greater than two inches (2") in diameter must be
Class 52 ductile iron pipe or PVC AWWA C-909 pressure class 235 pipe.
   (L)   Curb stops shall be Mueller H-15155 or A.Y. McDonald equivalent.
   (M)   Corporation stops shall be Mueller H-15008 or A.Y. McDonald
equivalent.
   (N)   Curb boxes shall be Mueller H-10300 complete with pentagon nut.
   (O)   Megalugs shall be used for mechanical joint restraints.
   (P) Distribution valve boxes shall be Tyler 664S box with a lid marked
"water." (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018; amd. Ord. 3229, 3-15-2021)
3-8-13: REPLACING OR REPAIRING WATER SERVICE:
   (A)   Between The Water Main And Premises: When a leak or break occurs in a
water service between the water main and the premises, the property owner is
responsible for repair or replacement. If the property owner has not taken
action within twenty four (24) hours after the owner has been notified, the
Water Division shall disconnect or shall cause the service to be disconnected.
The Water Division is authorized to undertake said disconnection by using Water
Division employees or by employing an independent contractor to perform such
service. The property owner shall be responsible for and shall pay all costs
incurred by the Water Division in disconnecting said service. If the Water
Division employees disconnect said service, costs shall be calculated on a time
and material basis; if the Water Division employs an independent contractor to
perform said service, the amount of the charges incurred by the City shall be
paid by the property owner. The property owner shall make payment in full
within thirty (30) days of receipt of said bill. If payment is not made within
said thirty (30) days, the water service shall be disconnected until the bill
is paid in full, plus payment of a fifty dollar ($50.00) fee. The owner shall
also be responsible for any fees for re-establishing service.
   (B)   Pipe One Inch Or Smaller: If a leak or break occurs in a water service
pipe having a one inch (1") or smaller diameter and said water service pipe
supplies more than one premises, then, at the time repairs are undertaken, each
property owner shall cause an individual service line to be installed from the
main to the building on the premises. The cost of such installation shall be
split between the property owners.
   (C)   Serious Damage: The Water Division has the right to shut off any
service leak or break at any time that said leak or break, in the opinion of
the Water Division, is causing or could cause serious damage to the street or
property. The property owner shall pay the Water Division on a time and
material basis.
   (D)   Street Reconstruction: All water services which are not type K soft
copper or SDR9 ADS polyflex (200 psi rating) shall be replaced prior to any
street improvements program where the street surface is completely removed and
thereafter replaced with either a portland cement concrete surface or a
bituminous concrete surface. The property owner may select a plumber of his or
her choice to replace the water service or it will be replaced by the Water
Division at the owner's expense. Water service shall also be extended to vacant
lots containing fifty feet (50') or more frontage. If the Water Division
performs the work, it will charge three hundred dollars ($300.00) to replace
each gooseneck and eight hundred dollars ($800.00) to replace water service
from the water main to the curb stop. The owner shall pay the full amount of
the bill within thirty (30) days to the Water Division. Failure to make said
payment shall result in the water service being terminated until said bill is
paid in full, plus a fifty dollar ($50.00) fee.
   (E)   Razed Properties: Disconnection at the water main shall be required on
all existing services where the property is being razed, except where otherwise
agreed by the Water Manager. Upon failure to do so, the Water Division may
disconnect service or cause the service to be disconnected at the owner's cost.
Owner shall pay all applicable fees and costs permitted under this chapter
which arise from such disconnection. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-14: OUTSIDE METER READING DEVICES:
(Rep. by Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-15: WATER RATES:
   (A)   Basic Water Service Charges: The water service charge for the use of
and for service supplied by the water division of the city shall consist of a
basic user charge, a debt service charge, and a capital improvement charge.
      1.   Basic User Charge: The basic user charge is the basic assessment
levied on all users of the city water system and is levied on all users to
recover the operation, maintenance plus replacement (OM&R) costs and shall be
based on water usage as recorded by water meters.
      The basic user charge shall be computed as follows:
         (a)   Estimate the annual water volume;
         (b)   Estimate the projected annual revenue required to operate and
maintain the Dixon water division, including a replacement fund for the year,
for all works categories; and
         (c)   Compute costs per one (1) gallon.
      2.   Debt Service Charge: The debt service charge shall be the amount to
be paid each billing period for payment of interest and principal of debt
outstanding and is computed by apportioning the annual debt service as a fixed
charge per billing period.
      3.   Capital Improvement Charge: The capital improvement charge is levied
on users to provide for capital improvements, extensions or reconstruction of
the waterworks. The capital improvement charge is computed by apportioning the
annual amount to be accrued as a fixed charge per billing period.
      4.   Measurement Of Flow: The volume of flow used for computing basic
user charges shall be the metered water consumption read to the lowest even
increments of one (1) gallon.
      5.   Adequacy Of Charge Reviewed: The adequacy of the water service
charge shall be reviewed, not less often than annually, by certified public
accountants for the water division in their annual audit report. The water
service charge shall be revised periodically to reflect a change in local
capital costs or OM&R costs.
      6.   Other Sources Prohibited: No consumer or owner shall procure any
part, or all, of his or her water from sources other than the city waterworks
system.
   (B)   Rates for all metered customers excluding Large Users shall be as
follows:
  FY22
                                       FY22
Basic User Rate           $/User/Month $9.48
Debt Service Rate         $/User/Month $10.26
Capital Improvement Rate  $/User/Month $2.57
Total Fixed Charge        $/User/Month $22.31
Excess Usage Rate
   2,244 - 747,252     $/Gallon     $0.0038
   Gallons
   747,252 - 7,479,252 $/Gallon     $0.0026
   Gallons
   Over 7,479,252 Gallo$/Gallon     $0.0017
 
      1.   Increase In Rates: Each of the rates set forth in subsection (B)
shall automatically increase by 7.5% of the FY22 rates of the total water and
sewer base and usage charges commencing with the July 15, 2022 meter read;
increase an additional 5.7% of the total water and sewer base and usage charges
commencing May 1, 2023; increase by 2.5% of the total water and sewer base and
usage charges on May 1, 2024 and May 1, 2025. The annual percent increase is
cumulative.
      2.   Computation Of Water Service Charge: The water service charge shall
be computed on a per meter basis according to the following formula:
   CW = CC + CD + CM + (Vu-X)CU
Where:  
 CW = Amount of water service charge ($) per billing period
 CC = Capital improvement charge
 CD = Debt service charge
 CM = Minimum charge for operation, maintenance and replacement
 Vu = Water volume for the billing period
 X  = Allowable consumption in gallons for the minimum charge
 CU = Basic user charge for operation, maintenance and replacement

      1.   Increase In Rates: Each of the rates set forth in subsection (C) of
this section shall automatically increase by 2.5% per annum over the previous
year on May 1 of each year commencing May 1, 2028.
      2.   Computation Of Water Service Charge: The water service charge shall
be computed on a per meter basis according to the following formula:
   CW = CC + CD + CM + (Vu-X)CU
Where:  
 CW = Amount of water service charge ($) per billing period
 CC = Capital improvement charge
 CD = Debt service charge
 CM = Minimum charge for operation, maintenance and replacement
 Vu = Water volume for the billing period
 X  = Allowable consumption in gallons for the minimum charge
 CU = Basic user charge for operation, maintenance and replacement

3-8-16: INTENT AND PURPOSE:
   (A)   Findings: The City Council finds and declares that the provisions of
this chapter are enacted for the following reasons:
      1.   To ensure timely and complete payment of all water charges arising
from water service supply to customers;
      2.   To regulate termination of water services to residential, commercial
and business customers for nonpayment of water charges;
      3.   To provide full and adequate notice to a residential, business or
commercial customer of a termination of water service to that customer and of
the procedure to follow to avoid termination;
      4.   To provide residential, business and commercial customers with the
fair and reasonable opportunity, prior to termination, to dispute the
correctness of water charges;
      5.   To standardize the notice of termination and other notices sent to
residential, business and commercial customers;
      6.   To regulate termination of water services to residential, business
or commercial rental property for nonpayment of water charges;
      7.   To regulate termination of water services to residences, businesses,
commercial or industrial property for failure to comply with section
3-8-2-1 of this chapter; and
      8.   To assure compliance with this chapter.
   (B)   Scope: The provisions of this chapter shall apply to water services
supplied to residential, business and commercial customers.
   (C)   Water Bills: On a monthly basis (or quarterly for those customers
without a Sensus water meter) a water bill shall be mailed or emailed, as
applicable, to every water customer for water service supplied during the time
period shown on the bill. Each water bill shall contain the following
information:
      1.   The time period and number of days of water service covered by the
water bill;
      2.   The water charge and/or installment and the water charge due, along
with any applicable discounts;
      3.   The date of the water bill;
      4.   The date when complete payment is due at City Hall, which shall be
at least twenty one (21) days from the date of the water bill;
      5.   Notice whether the water bill is based on actual or an estimated
measurement of the amount of water service supplied;
      6.   Notice that a water charge shown on a water bill is based on an
actual measurement, and which follows one or more bills based on estimated
measurements, may be substantially higher than previous water bills and higher
than the water bills based on estimated measurements;
      7.   Notice that failure to timely and completely pay the amount shown on
the water bill shall result in termination of water service; and
      8.   Notice that residential customers may call City Hall, whose
telephone number shall be listed on the water bill, in order to:
         (a)   Dispute the amount of the water charge;
         (b)   Avoid the termination of water service for nonpayment of the
amounts shown on the water bill;
         (c)   Request the restoration of water service; and
         (d)   Request answers to any other questions regarding water service.
   (D)   Customer Information: The Water Division shall provide information on
the following:
      1.   The procedure to dispute a water bill;
      2.   The procedure to avoid termination of water service due to
nonpayment of water charges;
      3.   The procedure for tenants to avoid termination of water service due
to the landlord's nonpayment of water charges;
      4.   The procedure to obtain reinstatement of water service; and
      5.   The procedure to avoid termination of water service due to failure
to comply with this chapter.
   (E)   Customer Dispute:
      1.   At any time before the date of termination of water service for
nonpayment of the amount shown on the water bill, or for a violation of this
chapter, or for a notice of rejection, a customer may dispute the basis of the
rejection or termination. The customer shall not be entitled to dispute the
basis of termination or rejection if the basis was the subject of a previous
dispute under this section.
      2.   The procedure for customer disputes shall be as follows:
         (a)   Before the date of termination, the customer shall notify the
Manager of the Water Division, orally or in writing that he disputes all or
part of the amounts shown on the water bill, the notice of rejection or notice
of termination, or any other reason for termination, stating as completely as
possible the basis for the dispute.
         (b)   If the Manager of the Water Division determines that the present
dispute is untimely or that the customer previously disputed the basis, the
Manager of the Water Division shall mail to the customer a notice stating that
the present dispute is untimely or invalid. A dispute is untimely if filed
after water service has been terminated. The Water Division shall then proceed
as if the customer had not notified the Water Division of the present dispute.
         (c)   If the Manager of the Water Division determines that the present
dispute is not untimely or invalid under this section, the Manager of the Water
Division, within three (3) days after receipt of the customer's notice, shall
arrange an informal meeting between the customer and the Manager of the Water
Division.
         (d)   Based on the Water Division's records, the customer's
allegations and all other relevant materials available to the Manager of the
Water Division, the Manager shall attempt to resolve the dispute in a manner
satisfactory to both the Water Division and the customer.
         (e)   Within five (5) days of completion of the meeting the Manager of
the Water Division shall mail to the customer a copy of his or her decision
resolving the dispute.
         (f)   If the decision is unsatisfactory to the customer, the customer,
within five (5) days of his or her receipt of the Manager's decision, may file,
in writing with the Manager a request for a formal hearing before the City
Council.
         (g)   The formal hearing before the City Council shall be held within
ten (10) days of the Manager's receipt of the customer's written request.
         (h)   At the hearing, the Manager of the Water Division and the
customer shall be entitled to present all evidence that is, in the City
Council's view, relevant and material to the dispute, and to examine and cross
examine witnesses. A tape recorded (or at the option of the Water Division, a
stenographic) record of the hearing shall be maintained.
         (i)   Based on the record established at the hearing, the City
Council, within five (5) days of the completion of the hearing, shall issue its
written decision formally resolving the dispute. This decision shall be final
and binding on the Water Division and on the customer.
      3.   Utilization of this dispute procedure shall not relieve a customer
of his or her obligation to: a) timely and completely pay: 1) all other
undisputed water charges and 2) the undisputed portions of the amounts which
are subject to the present dispute; and b) otherwise comply with this chapter.
Notwithstanding subsection (E)4 of this section, failure to timely and
completely pay all such undisputed amounts or to comply with this chapter,
shall subject the customer to termination of water service in accordance with
the provisions of this chapter.
      4.   Until the date of the Manager of the Water Division's or the City
Council's decision, whichever is later, the Water Division shall not terminate
the water service of the customer and shall not issue a notice of termination
to him solely based upon the matters in dispute. If it is determined that the
customer must pay some or all of the disputed amounts, or must take some action
to comply with this chapter, the Manager or the City Council shall promptly
mail to, or personally serve upon the customer a notice of termination, which
shall contain the following:
         (a)   The amount to be paid or the violation to be corrected;
         (b)   The date of the notice of termination;
         (c)   The date of termination, which shall be at least fifteen (15)
days after the date of the notice of termination; and
         (d)   Notice that unless the Water Division receives complete payment
in the amount shown prior to the date of termination, or that the violation has
been corrected, water service shall be terminated under subsection (F)4 of this
section.
   (F)   Water Service Termination Procedure:
      1.   Except as provided in subsection (E)4 of this section, the
provisions of this section shall govern all terminations of water service for
nonpayment of utility charges or for failure to comply with this chapter.
      2.   If by the payment date shown on a water bill the City has not
received complete payment of the amounts shown on the bill or the violation of
this chapter has not been corrected, the Water Division shall mail to, or
personally serve upon the customer a notice of termination at least three (3)
days after payment date or the date of the violation was to be corrected.
      3.   The notice of termination shall contain the following:
         (a)   The amount to be paid or the violation to be corrected;
         (b)   The date of the notice of termination;
         (c)   The date of termination, which shall be at least fifteen (15)
days from the date of the notice of termination;
         (d)   Notice that unless the Water Division receives complete payment
of the amount shown or that the violation has been corrected prior to the date
of termination, the water service shall be terminated under subsection (F)4 of
this section; and
         (e)   Notice that in lieu of paying the entire amount shown, a
customer, prior to the date of termination, may notify the utility that he
disputes the correctness of all or part of the amount shown if all or part of
the amount shown was not the subject of a previous dispute under subsection (E)
of this section, or that he disputes that he is in violation of this chapter.
The basis of the dispute shall not have been the subject of a previous dispute
under this chapter.
      4.   If, prior to the date of termination:
         (a)   The Water Division has not received complete payment of the
amount shown on the notice of termination;
         (b)   The customer has not notified the Water Division that he
disputes the correctness of all or part of the amount shown on the notice of
termination;
         (c)   The customer has not notified the Water Division that he
disputes that he has violated this chapter; or
         (d)   The customer has not corrected the violation shown on the notice
of violation;
then the Water Division shall terminate water service provided to the customer
on the date of termination.
      5.   If the Water Division receives payment of the entire amount shown on
the notice of termination or the violation has been corrected prior to the date
of termination, such payment or correction shall be considered timely for
purposes of this chapter.
   (G)   Limitations On Termination Of Water Service:
      1.   The Water Division shall terminate water service for nonpayment of
water charges only during hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. to four o'clock
(4:00) P.M., Monday through Thursday. No terminations shall be permitted on a
legal holiday or on the day before a legal holiday.
      2.   No terminations shall be permitted on a day when the low temperature
within the previous twenty four (24) hours, as reported by the National Weather
Service at its first order station nearest the residence, was below zero
degrees Fahrenheit (0°F). If water service to a residential customer has been
terminated and not reinstated by five o'clock (5:00) P.M. on the day of
termination, when the low temperature within the previous twenty four (24)
hours, as reported by the National Weather Service at its first order station
nearest the residence, was below thirty two degrees Fahrenheit (32°F), the
Water Division shall notify the Police Department on the day of termination of
the following:
         (a)   The name of the customer;
         (b)   The address and location of the residence no longer receiving
water service; and
         (c)   The possible threat to the health and life of all persons
residing at the residence.
      3.   The Water Division shall not terminate water service for nonpayment
of amounts less than twenty dollars ($20.00).
   (H)   Reinstatement Of Water Service: In the event of termination of water
service in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, the Water Division
shall reinstate water service to the customer within one full working day of
the Water Division's receipt of: 1) complete payment of the amount plus
associated fees whose nonpayment prompted the termination or 2) notice that the
violation has been corrected. Such payment or correction of violation shall not
be considered as timely for purposes of this chapter.
   (I)   Computation Of Time: In computing any period of time prescribed by
this chapter, the day of the act or event from which the designated period of
time begins to run shall not be included. The last day of the period so
computed shall be included, unless it is a Saturday, a Sunday or a legal
holiday, in which event the period runs until the next day which is not a
Saturday, a Sunday or a legal holiday. When the period of time prescribed is
less than seven (7) days, intermediate Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays
shall be excluded in the computation. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-17: CROSS CONNECTIONS:
   (A)   Definitions: For purposes of this section, the following definitions
shall apply:
   BACKFLOW: The reversal of flow from that normally intended. The flow of
water or other liquids, mixtures, or substances into the distributing pipe of a
potable supply of water from any source or sources other than its intended
source.
   CROSS CONNECTION: A connection or arrangement of piping or appurtenance
through which a backflow could occur.
   SAFE AIR GAP: The air gap in a water supply system that is the unobstructed
vertical distance through the free atmosphere between the lowest opening from
any pipe or faucet supplying water to a tank or plumbing fixture and the flood
level rim of the receptacle.
   SECONDARY WATER SUPPLY: The water supply system maintained in addition to
the public water supply system, including, but not limited to, water systems
from ground or surface resources, or water from a public water supply which in
any way has been treated, processed or exposed to any possible contaminant or
stored in other than an approved storage facility.
   SUBMERGED INLET: A water pipe or extension thereto from a public water
supply terminating in a tank, vessel, fixture or appliance which may contain
water of questionable quality, waste or other contaminant and which is
unprotected against backflow.
   WATER UTILITY OR PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM: The water system maintained by
the City of Dixon by and through its Water Division.
   (B)   Compliance With Existing Laws: All plumbing installed within the City
shall be installed in accordance with the State Plumbing Code (77 Ill. Admin.
Code 890). If required by the State Plumbing Code, or in the discretion of the
Water Manager, an approved backflow prevention device is necessary for the
safety of the public water supply system, the Water Manager shall give notice
to the water customer to install such a device. The approved device shall be
purchased and installed at the water customer's sole expense and at the
location designated by the Water Manager. Said installation shall comply with
any and all applicable Federal, State and local regulations. The owner shall
further, at his or her own expense, cause the backflow prevention device to be
tested annually by a plumber licensed and qualified to install and test such
backflow prevention devices. The owner shall be required to maintain the
backflow prevention device in a state of repair as to prevent any backflow or
contamination of the public water supply.
   (C)   Cross Connection: Cross connection of the public water supply system
and any other water supply system or source, including, but not limited to, the
following is prohibited:
      1.   Between a public water supply system and a secondary water supply;
      2.   Between a public water supply system and a submerged inlet;
      3.   Between a lawn sprinkling system and the public water supply system;
and
      4.   Between a public water supply system and piping immersed in a tank
or vessel which may contain a contaminant.
   (D)   Local Cross Connection Control Program: The City shall develop a
comprehensive control program for the elimination and prevention of all cross
connections and removal of all existing cross connections and prevention of all
future cross connections. The City has hired a third party provider to oversee
its cross connection control program. Said party reviews, manages and maintains
this information on behalf of the City.
   (E)   Corrections And Protective Devices: Any user of the public water
supply system shall obtain written approval from the Water Division of any
proposed corrective action or protective device intended to eliminate or
prevent a cross connection before its use or installation. The time allowed for
completion of the necessary corrective action required to eliminate cross
connections shall be dependent upon the degree of hazard involved and the time
required to obtain and install the equipment. If the cross connection has not
been removed within the time as hereinafter specified, the City shall
physically separate the public water supply system from the on site piping
system in such a manner that the two (2) systems cannot be connected by persons
other than employees of the Water Division.
   (F)   Piping Identification: When a secondary water source is used in
addition to the public water supply system, the public water supply and the
secondary water piping shall be identified by distinguishing colors or tags and
so maintained that each pipe may be readily traced in its entirety to its
origin in order to protect the public water supply at the service connection in
a manner acceptable to the Water Division.
   (G)   Private Water Storage Tanks: A private water storage tank supplied
from the public water supply system shall be deemed a secondary water supply
unless it is designed and approved for potable water usage.
   (H)   Elimination Of Existing Cross Connections: Within one year from the
effective date of this section all existing cross connections to the water
supply system shall be eliminated. The expenses of such elimination shall be
that of the property owner on which such cross connection exists.
   (I)   Inspection: The Water Division or any representative thereof shall
have the authority to inspect any premises to determine the presence of an
existing cross connection and to order the elimination of such cross
connection. Any new plumbing system shall be inspected by a licensed plumber
certified by the State as a cross connection control device inspector. (Ord.
3110, 9-17-2018)
   (J)   Discontinuance Of Water Service: The Water Division is hereby
authorized to discontinue water service after reasonable notice to any person
owning any property where a cross connection exists in violation of this Code.
The Water Division may take such other measures as necessary to eliminate any
danger of contamination of the public water supply system. Water service to
such property shall not be restored until such cross connection has been
eliminated. The Water Division may immediately disconnect any water service,
after verbal notice to the occupant of the premises, when there exists an
imminent danger of harmful contamination to the public water supply system at
any premises served by the City water system. Within a reasonable time after
such immediate disconnection, the Water Division shall provide written
notification to the customer of the cause for disconnection. Immediate
disconnection without notice to any party can be effected to prevent actual or
anticipated contamination or pollution of the public water supply, provided
that, in the reasonable opinion of the Water Manager or the State Environmental
Protection Agency, such action is required to prevent actual or potential
contamination or pollution of the public water supply. All expenses incurred
for the disconnection and restoration of the water service will be the
responsibility of the property owner. (Ord. 3114, 11-5-2018)
   (K)   Reimbursement For Cleanup Of Water Supply: Any water customer
responsible for back-siphoned or back-pressured material or contamination
through backflow, if contamination of the potable water supply system occurs
through an illegal cross connection or an improperly installed, maintained or
repaired device, or a device which has been bypassed, shall pay and reimburse
the City for all costs of elimination of the contamination and cleanup of the
potable water supply system caused by such cross connection or backflow.
   (L)   Prohibition: No user of the City water supply system shall cause or
allow any cross connection to exist on his or her premises. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-
2018)
3-8-18: PENALTY:
Any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be fined not less than
twenty five dollars ($25.00) nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars
($750.00) for each offense and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on
each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues. (Ord. 2080, 4-20-
1998)
3-8-19: GENERAL FINANCIAL PROVISIONS:
   (A)   Revenue: All revenues and monies derived from the operation of the
waterworks system shall be deposited in the operations and maintenance account
of the Water Division. The City Treasurer shall receive all such revenues from
the waterworks system and all other funds and monies incident to the operation
of the system. All such revenues and monies shall be deposited by the City
Treasurer not more than ten (10) days after receipt or at such more frequent
intervals as may be from time to time directed by the City Council. The City
Treasurer shall administer such funds in accordance with this Code and the
Illinois Municipal Code.
   (B)   Accounts: The City Treasurer shall establish a proper system of
accounts and shall keep proper books, records and accounts in which complete
and correct entries shall be made of all transactions relative to the
waterworks system. At regular annual intervals the City Council shall cause to
be made an audit of the books of the waterworks system by an independent
auditor. Said audit shall reflect the annual revenues and expenses of the
system, including replacement costs. Said financial information shall also
include the following:
      1.   Flow data showing total gallons received for the current fiscal
year;
      2.   Billing data to show the total number of gallons billed for the
fiscal year;
      3.   Debt service for the next succeeding fiscal year;
      4.   Number of users connected to the waterworks system; and
      5.   Number of non-metered users.
   (C)   Access To Records: The Illinois EPA or its authorized representative
shall have access to any books, documents, papers and records of the Water
Division, which are applicable to the waterworks system for the purpose of
making an audit, examination, excerpts and transcriptions thereof to ensure
compliance with the terms of any loan agreement between the City and the
Illinois EPA or any special or general conditions of any grant received by the
City from the State of Illinois. (Ord. 3110, 9-17-2018)
3-8-20: RESIDENTIAL WATER SERVICE LINE REPAIR PROGRAM:
   (A)   Creation Of Program: There is hereby established a Residential Water
Service Line Repair Program which shall be utilized for the purpose of
assisting Eligible residential properties with the timely repair, replacement
and/or relocation of leaking service lines, and the costs associated therewith.
   (B)   Definitions: The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this
section, shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein, except where the
context clearly indicates a different meaning:
                               An owner or his, her or its designee, or an

                               respect to the eligible residential property.

                               is assessed as residential property containing
                               not more than four (4) dwelling units. To

                               owner/applicant shall be current on all water
                               and sewer bills with respect to the real estate,
                               including the charge levied pursuant to section
                               3-8-20(C)1.

                               digging, replacement of dirt and seeding of
                               affected areas resulting from any of the
                               foregoing. Eligible Service Line Repairs shall
                               be made to the nearest curb stop. An Eligible
